intro: Dyschoriste gracilicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Dyschoriste gracilicaulis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
